intro: Oxydectes subfloccosa, commonly known as the woolly false nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes species known for their stinging hairs. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in shaded or partially shaded environments. Its botanical features make it distinguishable from other members of the Urticaceae family.
